content.description:
Start at a thin crack/seam and climb up to a bolt then make crux moves as you work left with good flakes for the hands and marginal feet to gain an obvious curving crack. Continue up the fun crack to it's end, pass a horizontal and then stand up on flakes to clip another bolt which protects moves over the shoulder and onto the slab above which is followed to anchors atop the tower.

The protection is actually good on this route but until the 1/4" bolts with Leeper hangers are replaced this should be considered a serious lead.
content.location: West face of the Black Tower.

content.description:
Gain access to this upper pitch by climbing

Crossbow

or

Black Tower Crack

(starts on the belay ledge). From the anchors move right past 2 bolts on an airy traverse, then up into a small seam then meander towards the right on bigger face holds.

Belay at large tree or gear anchor
content.location: Located on the top headwall of Black Tower Buttress.

content.description: From anchors atop the buttress climb left a few feet to reach a short section of crack which quickly ends and continue up via delicate face to anchors. A series of two short rappels get you back to the ground.

From anchors atop the buttress climb right a few feet to a bolt and then head straight up into a sweet, thin crack which leads to anchors at the top of the face. You may be able to link the approach pitch and this route into one longer pitch, but rope drag may be an issue; if considering this Crossbow is probably the better choice. Return to the ground in two short raps.
content.protection: One bolt, gear to 1.5 inches, 2 bolt anchor/rap
content.location:
This route starts from the ledge atop the Black Tower Buttress and, as the name indicates, climbs the center of the headwall above. Approach via

Crossbow

on the left side of the buttress or

Black Tower Crack

which is on the right side of the butress facing east.
